column1: 3.3.3.2.1	 Summary of evidence and recommendations for diagnostic imaging in children

Offer a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory as the first drug of choice; e.g., metamizole*   (dipyrone); alternatively paracetamol or, depending on cardiovascular risk factors,   diclofenac**, indomethacin or ibuprofen***.
Offer opioids (hydromorphine, pentazocine or tramadol) as a second choice.
Offer renal decompression or ureteroscopic stone removal in case of analgesic refractory   colic pain.
